step1.sentence: She grew up in a small coastal town where everyone knew everyone.

step2.story: When people ask David what he wants to be when he grows up, he always says an astronaut. His parents smile and buy him books about space every birthday.

step3.story: Growing up, Mei shared a small bedroom with her two sisters and a single bookshelf they all used together. There was never much space but somehow never a dull moment. Now that they all live in different cities, she looks back on those cramped evenings as some of the warmest memories of her life.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어린이에서 어른으로 성장하다; 나이를 먹고 성숙해지다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 어린 시절부터 어른이 되는 과정이나 자라난 환경을 묘사할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: grow(자라다)와 up(위로, 완성)이 결합하여 위로 자라 완전한 어른이 된다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 어린이의 성장 과정을 나타낼 때 가장 많이 씁니다. 어른에게 철 좀 들어라는 뉘앙스로 쓰기도 합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I grew up in Seoul but moved abroad when I was eighteen.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 서울에서 자랐지만 열여덟 살 때 해외로 이사했어요.
